Utterance: Hi, it's Ellie again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi! I've been okay, you know, just trying to keep my spirits up despite everything.
That’s good to hear. Last time we talked about your stroke and how it’s affected your life. Have you noticed any changes since then?
Well, I’ve been trying to focus on the positive aspects, but the nerve damage in my hand is still a challenge. It can get frustrating, especially when I’m trying to work.
I can imagine how difficult that must be. Have you been able to incorporate any new coping strategies since we last spoke?
I’ve been trying to meditate more regularly. It helps, but some days are harder than others.
That’s a great step. Meditation can really help with managing stress. Have you found any particular techniques that work better for you?
I’ve been following the guided meditations from Deepak Chopra. I find his voice calming, and it helps me focus.
That’s wonderful! How do you feel after meditating?
I feel more centered and relaxed, but sometimes I struggle to quiet my mind. It’s like my thoughts just keep racing.
That’s a common experience. It might help to acknowledge those thoughts without judgment and gently bring your focus back to your breath.
Yes, I’ve tried that. It does help a bit. I just have to remind myself it’s okay to have those thoughts.
Exactly! How about your photography? Have you had any opportunities to shoot recently?
I’ve had a few small gigs, but nothing major. It’s tough finding paid work right now.
I understand. What do you think is holding you back from getting more jobs?
I think it’s a combination of things—my health issues, and the competition in the industry. Sometimes I feel like I’m not good enough.
It’s normal to feel that way, especially in a competitive field. Have you considered reaching out to past clients or networking in any way?
I haven’t done much networking lately. I guess I’ve been feeling a bit isolated since the stroke.
Isolation can be tough. Maybe we can set a goal for you to reach out to at least one person this week?
That sounds doable. I can start with an old client I enjoyed working with.
That’s a great idea! It might help to rekindle those connections. How do you feel about that?
I feel a little nervous, but also excited. It’s been a while since I’ve reached out to someone in the industry.
That’s completely understandable. It’s a good step towards rebuilding your professional network.
Yes, I think it will help me feel more connected again.
Speaking of connection, how’s your relationship with your daughters been lately?
It’s been good, but I think I need to give them a bit more space. Sometimes I feel like I’m relying on them too much.
It’s great that you recognize that. How do you think you can create more independence for both you and them?
I could start by planning some activities for myself—maybe join a class or a group.
That sounds like a wonderful idea! What kind of activities interest you?
I’ve always wanted to try painting again. It could be a nice way to express myself.
That could be very therapeutic! Would you consider looking into local art classes?
Yes, I think I will! It might help me meet new people too.
Absolutely! It can be a great way to connect with others who share your interests.
I’m feeling more hopeful just thinking about it.
That’s fantastic to hear! Remember, it’s all about taking one step at a time.
Yes, I’m learning that.
Is there anything else you’d like to explore today?
I guess I’m just worried about my upcoming disability hearing. It’s been weighing on my mind.
That’s understandable. The waiting can be stressful. How have you been coping with that anxiety?
I’ve been trying to stay busy, but it’s hard not to think about it.
Have you thought about any specific ways to manage that anxiety as the date approaches?
Maybe I could write down my feelings or talk to someone about it.
Journaling can be a great outlet! Would you like to set a goal to write down your thoughts this week?
Yes, I think that would help me process everything.
Great! It sounds like you have some good strategies to work on.
Thank you for your support, Ellie.
Of course! I’m here for you. Let’s check in next week to see how it all goes.
Sounds good! I’m looking forward to it.
Me too! Take care until then.
Bye!
